reviews.title: Noisy room
reviews.text: This hotel has an old part where the rooms are in bad shape and they are close to the noisy road. The new part of the hotel is quite nice, and you have a lovely view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The thing is that you can’t make a reservation in the new part of the hotel. You have to take whatever’s available when you arrive. We called them 3 months before arriving and asked if we could reserve a room in the new part of the hotel. They told us that it was impossible and we just had to take what was available when we arrived. And when we arrived three months later the new part off the hotel was full , off course….and the room we had to stay in was really really old and next to the road. We had to sleep with ear plugs the hotel staff are rude and not helpful at all. I would only recommend the hotel if u can get a room in the new part away from the road. But there are a lot of nice hotels in Malaga that are 10 times better.
reviews.title: Great view of the sea from my bed!

reviews.text: The write ups here aren't good so I wasn't expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised, nice room with a great view of the sea. Didn't find it noisy, maybe I'm a bit deaf! The staff were helpful and did speak English which was great for me who doesn't yet understand Spanish.
reviews.title: Not bad for the money

likes.liked: — It is out of the town centre and it is not generally noisy except the walls are thin.
likes.disliked: — the thin walls and lack of facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I h ave stayed at this hotel on many occasions and have to concur with the other guests that the staff are miserable and unhelpful but then I find that in general in Spain, in the shops and everywhere else!!!!!
reviews.title: Nice views, big rooms, noisy road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is pretty basic and the walls are thin, you can hear everything through them but it is clean and cheap and ideal for a couple of days break.
reviews.title: about as friendly as a rattle snake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Las Vegas in August this year. We had booked via Tripadvisor and were paying less than £40 a night and at this price the hotel offers good value. The hotel is well situated to explore the city and offers good size rooms with balconys, though strangely for a double room the balcony only had one chair. Breakfast was standardand as we didn't eat in the hotel I can't comment. The pool is small and overlooks the busy n340
reviews.title: ok but get a deal

reviews.text: I dont think I have ever met such unhelpful/ bad mannered reception staff in my life. One female and two older male staff were certainly not doing much for public relations for this hotel. Any question was too much for them. They seemed to have a little English but had no interest in using it. As soon as you asked them a question it seemed that they had a one word answer ready and then they turned away and left you standing there.On reading the adds for this hotel it seemed to have everything we needed for our 5 day break, Close to city, near the beach, swimming pool, minibar etc. The location was good just about 20mins walk from city centre and quite near the beach. We had asked for a room on the lower floor and when we arrived we found we were on the 6th (Top) floor. When we asked if there was anything else we were told no so we said we would see the room anyway. The first thing that struck you when you got out of the elevator on the landing was the smell. It was a strong musty/damp smell and it was also there to a certain degree in the bedroom but not as bad. We think it may have been caused by the condensation from the drinks machine on the landings maybe making the carpet damp. Some days the smell was so bad we just took a deep breath as we left the elevator and ran to the bedroom so we could take the next breath. The room was clean but basic and dated the balcony door did not lock (they did fix this without delay) there was no door on the safe in the room and no sign of a minibar (this didnt matter we were not really drinkers anyway) When we went back to reception and mentioned the smell in the room they said they would have an airfreshner spray used. We did not kick up a fuss and just accepted the room as it was.
reviews.title: Never Again

likes.disliked: — The reception staff and the smell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel bar was never opened till 11 as stated and when we asked if we could have a little ice for our water we were told 'not possible, another night 7 Up or Sprite NO. We did not want to use the drinks machines as there seemed to be a lot of mold or something on the shelves and were not sure how safe this was.The bar staff and the waiters were fine to deal with.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The view was lovely looking over the beach and we enjoyed the pool area as the weather was warm and the pool was quiet most days. I think it was such a pity as this could have been such a nice hotel with a little effort from staff. The city of Malaga was lovely and we did enjoy our time there but the hotel certainly did not measure up. I would visit Malaga again but would stay well away from the Las Vegas hotel
reviews.title: Old style hotel a bit 'remodeled'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a total of six nigths, and everything worked out perfectly. We wanted to spend as much time on the beach as possible, and for this, this hotel has a perfect location.
reviews.title: OK hotel but nothing special.

reviews.text: i have just arrived back from what i thought was going to be a tourist holiday for myself my daughter and mum. ive never been so bored in all my life! yes theres a pool but even tho sun out all day it was freezing! , theres was only two sunbeds between everyone.the view was lovely as from our very nice room we could see the beach. some must be wondering what was wrong, well the fact there are no shops nearby apart from a little' rip off the british' newsagent (he made prices up depending on accent)! and u can only get papers mon-fri, no restaurants that speak english(apart from a chinese one, he was a lovely chap and food was ace, highlight of hol!,) ,no gift shops,no bars! just a totally spanish place that by the looks on the miserable spanish faces, thats how they want to keep it ! couldnt wait to get to the airport back home! only go if staying max 2 days or want a totally boring quiet time!
reviews.title: not a family hol !

likes.liked: — view from hotel room if you can overlook the very busy road before the beach.
likes.disliked: — nothing to do day or night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Las vegas hotel a few nights some years ago. The rooms was okey and fresh and clean. The breakfast was very good. The pool is small ánd cosy. The most bad thing was the big motorways that disturbed you in the night and when you were bathing in the pool. For just a few nights I think its ok to visit this hotel....
reviews.title: Cosy pool, fresh room but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was well situated near to the city centre and the beach.
reviews.title: Great Value

likes.liked: — Location near to the city centre

reviews.text: The room was clean and well presented the bathroom was dated but clean. The breakfast was fine and the dining room overlooked the pool and promenade.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was excellent value for money and was ideal for a city break.
reviews.title: Like sleeping in the middle of the Motorway

likes.disliked: — The noise and lack of a fridge/mini bar

reviews.text: Very nice property. The only bad thing is road between hotel and the beach, but it did not disturb me enjoing my stay at Las Vegas, especially taking into account, that I got room with sea view for very little price. Thanks God I'm travel agent :P
reviews.title: Almost excellent!

likes.disliked: — Road separating property from the beach

reviews.title: this hotel is 3 star - basic decorations but bedrooms very spacious and clean se
reviews.text: this hotel was in a residential position felt very safe to walk
we had rooms overlooking the sea and noise of busy road
reviews.title: magic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: did not boter us. Views of palms and sea a bonus
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.text: walking into City very good. Bull ring and bus stops very close
reviews.title: Good hotel
